Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 01 October, 2021 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on WRC Secto Automotive Rally Finland, 2021. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

Overall Standings 0.1 Rally Sparkline Summary 0.2 Off-the-Pace Chart 0.3 Stage Pace 0.4 Gap to Overall Leader at Each Stage End 0.5 Stage Wins Summary 0.6 Penalties 0.7 Retirements 0.8 Stage Position History 0.9 Stage Times 0.10 Stage Time Deltas 0.11 Stage Win Truth 0.12 Overall Position 0.13 Overall Lead Truth 0.14 Gap to the Driver in Overall Lead at Each Stage End 0.15 Text report

Overall Standings Summary reports of overall standings and stage results. 0.1 Rally Sparkline Summary Simple summary charts of rally progress for each driver, ordered by latest overall ranking: ## Not enough data for a meaningful table... 0.2 Off-the-Pace Chart Overall time deltas at each stage relative to overall leader: TO DO - this is misleading. Drivers fall of the pace are dropped the chart but the chart should show the line going off the chart. 0.3 Stage Pace Stage pace charts rebased to overall leader. TO DO - the fastest pace line should have a purple colour. 0.4 Gap to Overall Leader at Each Stage End The gap to the overall leader at the end of each stage, with table ordered by overall rally position at end of last recorded stage: code SS1 KAT 0.0 NEU 0.2 LAP 0.3 TÄN 0.4 FOU 0.9 OGI 1.1 EVA 1.3 BRE 1.4 ROV 1.9 GRE 3.2 0.5 Stage Wins Summary Summary of stage wins. code wins wincount KAT SS1 1 0.6 Penalties 0.7 Retirements 0.8 Stage Position History Ranked according to position on last recorded stage not overall position. The advantage of this ordering is that it helps register “surprise” arising from a perhaps unexpected stage winner. The chart gives the summary of stage rank evolution. Note that the stage position is based on the positions given by WRC Live Timing. If two drivers record the same time (or at least, same time to a tenth of a second), only one of them will have position==1 and the other will be position==2. A different “first” truth can be generated by testing on gap==0.0. code SS1 KAT 1 NEU 2 LAP 3 TÄN 4 FOU 5 OGI 6 EVA 7 BRE 8 ROV 9 GRE 10 0.9 Stage Times Summary of raw stage times code SS1 KAT 109.7 NEU 109.9 LAP 110.0 TÄN 110.1 FOU 110.6 OGI 110.8 EVA 111.0 BRE 111.1 ROV 111.6 GRE 112.9 0.10 Stage Time Deltas Summary of stage time deltas (gap to stage winner in seconds): code SS1 KAT 0.0 NEU 0.2 LAP 0.3 TÄN 0.4 FOU 0.9 OGI 1.1 EVA 1.3 BRE 1.4 ROV 1.9 GRE 3.2 0.11 Stage Win Truth Originally developed to support the automated text summary production, the stage win truth table provides a glanceable view summarising the stage winner on each stage: ## code SS1 ## 1 KAT TRUE ## 2 NEU FALSE ## 3 LAP FALSE ## 4 TÄN FALSE ## 5 FOU FALSE ## 6 OGI FALSE ## 7 EVA FALSE ## 8 BRE FALSE ## 9 ROV FALSE ## 10 GRE FALSE 0.12 Overall Position Evolution of overall position: code SS1 KAT 1 NEU 2 LAP 3 TÄN 4 FOU 5 OGI 6 EVA 7 BRE 8 ROV 9 GRE 10 0.13 Overall Lead Truth Originally produced to support text summary generation, the overall lead truth tables provide glanceable views over how the overal lead developed over each stage. Truth tables include glanceable reviews of the overall leader, as well as overall lead gains, losses and retention. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 1.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times
